definition: to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

sentences.english: O check cloth AnYi thought is class d.
sentences.chinese: 布安姨以为是华班查对阿丁不满。

sentences.english: I'll check into it and get back to you.
sentences.chinese: 我查对一下然后送还给你。

sentences.english: Every week the time sheets were scrutinised .
sentences.chinese: 每星期都要仔细查对计工表。

sentences.english: I'll check into it and get back to you。
sentences.chinese: 我查对一下然后送还给你。

sentences.english: I don'tthinkthecostischanged, but I 'll have to check up.
sentences.chinese: 我想费用没有变动，但我还是要查对一下。

sentences.english: Objective To examine the effect of inquiry-checking in the prevention of errors in medical services.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨询问式查对在预防医疗差错中的作用。

sentences.english: B:That's fine.Thank you very much for checking.
sentences.chinese: 好的，非常谢谢你的查对。

sentences.english: Get several written quotations and check exactly what's included in the cost.
sentences.chinese: 要几份书面报价，仔细查对费用中包含的内容。

sentences.english: There's a lunar calendar for us to check the dates.
sentences.chinese: 我们有一本农历可供查对。

sentences.english: I"ll check into it and get back to you.
sentences.chinese: 我查对一下然后送还给你。

definition: to ascertain/to identify/to verify (sb's identity etc)
statistical form/book of tables or forms
to examine/to investigate/to try to determine
to reconsider/to reexamine/to review (e.g. a report prior to accepting it)
to follow up a study/to investigate
